Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Donald Trump "cancelled" the ID2020 project, when there is no evidence to support this.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or mention of Trump taking any action against ID2020.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Trump cancelled the ID2020 project, without providing any evidence or basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation that the claim is false, as fact-checking organizations and experts have found no evidence of Trump cancelling the ID2020 project.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that ID2020 is a digital identification program supported by Microsoft and an organization funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by making a false statement without any evidence or support.
